The Chinese call it zuo yue zi, which means â€œto sit a month.â€ In addition, the mother must also follow a very strict diet.æ­¦æ±‰28å²çš„å»–å¥³å£«å¹³æ—¶é¦‹å˜´ï¼Œæ€€å­•åå°±æ›´åŠ çˆ±åƒï¼Œå®¶äººæ¢ç€èŠ±æ ·åšè¥å…»é¤ï¼Œä¸ˆå¤«ä¹Ÿé™ªç€ä¸€èµ·åƒã€‚å‡ºäº†æœˆå­å»åšæ£€æŸ¥ï¼Œå¤«å¦»ä¿©éƒ½æ‚£ä¸Šäº†èƒ†ç»“çŸ³ã€‚åæœˆå­è‹±æ–‡è§£é‡ŠWhat is the Traditional Chinese Postpartum Confinement Practice of â€œSitting the monthâ€ aka zuÃ² yuÃ¨ zi and itâ€™s rules?According to many Chinese medical practitioners, the months immediately following childbirth are one of the most crucial times for any new mother.  It is during this period of rest when the new momâ€™s body is the most fragile and susceptible to sickness.  It is believed that by following the cultural and traditional practice of â€œsitting the monthâ€, new moms can avoid lifelong health issues such as arthritis, aches, and pains throughout the body, and even eyesight problems.
